newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-SAMMER MAY STAY AT DORTMUND UNTIL CAREER END.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SAMMER MAY STAY AT DORTMUND UNTIL CAREER END.

text.p: European footballer of the year Matthias Sammer is considering extending his contract at Borussia Dortmund in a deal that would keep him at the club for the rest of his playing career.
The 29-year-old libero, whose contract with the German champions runs until 1999, said it was too early to make a commitment but the prospects for an extension were good.

"If I decide to stay at Dortmund until the end of my career, then everything must be right. The way things look at the moment, everything is right," he told Thursday's edition of the German sports magazine Kicker.
"But we'll all sit down at the end of the year or the beginning of 1998 and make a final decision."

Sammer said Dortmund would have to maintain their progress of the past few years, when they have gone from Bundesliga also-rans to being among Europe's biggest names, and top officials would have to remain in place for him to consider staying.

Sammer, awarded the Golden Ball in December after being voted European player of 1996 by the continent's sportswriters, was linked with a possible move to Dortmund's title rivals Bayern Munich last year.
"I'm pleased I didn't fall for the allure of Bayern," he said. "I feel really happy at Borussia at the moment."
